DataElement.preferredName: Demographics Demographics Population Group Type DemographicTypeCode
DataElement.preferredDefinition: statistical characterization of human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.)._The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).:A group of individuals united by a common factor (e.g., geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender):Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._Code for type of demographic grouping

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: statistical characterization of human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.).

Concepts.definition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Property.preferredDefinition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).:A group of individuals united by a common factor (e.g., geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender):Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).
A group of individuals united by a common factor (e.g., geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender)
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/1/10 Changed workflow status to Released. mcooper

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Code for type of demographic grouping

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Groups of individuals united by a common factor e.g. geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender, etc.

Concepts.definition: A group of individuals united by a common factor (e.g., geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

Concepts.definition: An indication of the years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gain or recurrent benefit during a period of time, usually measured in money that derives from capital or labor. Income is one of the major demographic parameters used in population-based biomedical research.

Concepts.definition: A gain or recurrent benefit during a period of time, usually measured in money that derives from capital or labor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective and comparative term describing a lack of sufficient wealth (usually understood as capital, money, material goods, or resources especially natural resources) to live what is understood in a society as a "normal" life: for instance, to be capable of raising a healthy family, and especially educating children and participating in society. A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world.

Concepts.definition: A subjective and comparative term describing a lack of sufficient wealth (usually understood as capital, money, material goods, or resources especially natural resources) to live what is understood in a society as a "normal" life: for instance, to be capable of raising a healthy family, and especially educating children and participating in society. A person living in this condition of poverty is said to be poor. The meaning of "sufficient" varies widely across the different political and economic areas of the world.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A situation in which people or things are excessively close together.

Concepts.definition: A situation in which people or things are excessively close together.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A state of separation; the act of setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.:A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.

Concepts.definition: A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.
A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The ability to move with ease and without restriction.

Concepts.definition: The ability to move with ease and without restriction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to, located in, or characteristic of a city or densely populated area.

Concepts.definition: Relating to, located in, or characteristic of a city or densely populated area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Total number of a country's population employed in jobs, plus those unemployed people who are seeking work; the entire group of employees in a company.

Concepts.definition: Total number of a country's population employed in jobs, plus those unemployed people who are seeking work; the entire group of employees in a company.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 4/1/10 Changed workflow status to released. mcooper
